column4: My server machine has internet connection yet all software sources are down??? Can't seem to update or install anything :(
What's the error msg?
Can you write to the disk at all? `touch /tmp/aoeu`
no it says read only...actually, let me reboot I seem to remember a problem with mounting on start-up (I am running encrypted LVM)
I think I found the problem, you made me stop and think. I edited a file having to do with the partitions in the tutorial. I am in manual recovery, I'm going to try and undo what I did earlier.
So you do `sudo reboot` and it says those things and just hangs?
Yes
Btw don't hard-reset. If you have to, use Magic SysRq  key shortcuts. It shuts machine down softer
Okay, thanks. Do you have a link to those? If not I will search.
And since you said the root partition is mounted read-only, I don't think it's a big deal to reboot that way. And they're on google))
Okay, good. Yeah I found out what I did, I didn't add my line correctly in /etc/fstab and I just need to change it, but I am working on that since everything is read-only
Thanks for that. I wish they had that back in windows98 :D
np)) had what in w98? :)

One little problem I am confident you can solve :) I need to edit /etc/fstab but it doesn't seem to let me because it is read-only...But everything is read-only because of an error while mounting...because of the file error (thanks to me). Any ideas?
I remember with `mount` you can give it something like "-o remount,rw" to remount it as read-writable. it's in the manual

Okay, almost there, when I try to remount, it mentions an "unrecognized mount option" which is part of the line I entered incorrectly in /etc/fstab. It mentions "jqfmt=vfsv" which is supposed to be "jqfmt=vfs0". Any way to call it with the 0 from command line?
What even is "jqfmt=vfsv" is? what does it mean?
Here is a pastebin for you: http://paste.ubuntu.com/1129512/
Here is what I was talking about in a pastebin, but I must go now, thanks for the help PM if you have any ideas based on it, thanks very much: http://paste.ubuntu.com/1129512/
I'll look at it and PM if I know, see you))
Thanks a million!
